definition: (onom.) chirping of insects, sighing noise etc

sentences.english: After a while Hem's and Haw's confidence grew into arrogance37.
sentences.chinese: 後來，哼哼和唧唧的自信開始變成狂妄。

sentences.english: Our vision helped us turn many of our Hems into Haws.
sentences.chinese: 這種景象使許多的哼哼變成了唧唧。

sentences.english: The schoolgirls chippered on their way to school.
sentences.chinese: 女學生們在上學途中唧唧喳喳地說個不停。

sentences.english: On the grass, grasshoppers singing near by them with gi gi zi zi .
sentences.chinese: 草地上，唧唧織織的草蜢不時在旁和聲高唱。

sentences.english: Numerous kinds of insects group themselves and chirrup , in the fields and the golden sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 各類昆蟲聚集在金色的陽光下唧唧地鳴叫。

sentences.english: Chinchillas make a variety of vocalizations, including chirps, squeaks, and barks.
sentences.chinese: 龍貓作出了各種發聲，包括呻吟，唧唧叫和哨音。

sentences.english: Yep, instead of hemming and hawing, just grab your tennis shoes and go for a run.
sentences.chinese: 對，別磨磨唧唧的了，把運動鞋抓過來去跑步吧。

sentences.english: I like to look up at the blue sky , see the birds chirping and smile .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡擡頭看藍天，聽小鳥唧唧的叫，然後會心一笑。

sentences.english: They were probably no wiser than a cricket's chirrup.
sentences.chinese: 它們並不比一隻蟋蟀唧唧的叫聲更加高明。

sentences.english: But Haw realized that he had already tried to get his friend to change.
sentences.chinese: 但唧唧又想起他已經試圖改變過他的失敗經歷。

sentences.english: Young willows were ethereal, spring breeze so caressing, and birds were chirping in unison.
sentences.chinese: 嫩柳輕飄，春風盪漾，小鳥唧唧地歡唱。

sentences.english: The boy chirped a few notes and stopped suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 男孩唧唧地唱了幾聲就突然不唱了。

sentences.english: Chicks cheep and can't count sheep to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 小雞唧唧喳喳，數綿羊也睡不着。

sentences.english: Listen to the jabber of those monkeys .
sentences.chinese: 你聽那羣猴子唧唧喳喳的叫聲。

sentences.english: The sparrows are chattering in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀在花園中唧唧喳喳地叫。
一陣唧唧喳喳的說話聲。

definition: to cry out/to bark out a sound
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
